citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau
citeinfo.title: United States Census Block Centroid Populations, 2020

descript.abstract: U.S. Census Block Points represents the 2020 U.S. Census blocks for the United States as points. U.S. Census blocks nest within all other tabulated census geographic entities at the time of the decennial census and are the basis for all tabulated data from that census.
descript.purpose: U.S. Census Block Points provides population and other demographic information for each U.S. Census block (represented as a point) within the United States.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States- Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, contact Esri by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing +1-888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at +1-909-792-0960; or visit https://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States- Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by email, telephone, or fax or write to us.

dataqual.logic: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this dataset is calculated from latitude and longitude coordinates. The horizontal positional accuracy is unknown.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau
citeinfo.title: 2020 Census Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary Files

serinfo.sername: Census Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary Files

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

citeinfo.othercit: The geospatial data is calculated from the latitude and longitude coordinates in the 2020 Census Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary Files.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Downloaded the 2020 Census Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary Files from the U.S. Census Bureau. Created the block points from these data files. Projected the dataset to World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS84). Added fields STATE_FIPS, COUNTY_FIPS, STCOFIPS, TRACT_FIPS, BLOCKGROUP_FIPS, and BLOCK_FIPS and created their values from parsing the values of the FIPS field. Reordered and renamed fields.

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent the census blocks, the smallest geographic entities for which the Census Bureau collects and tabulates decennial census information within the United States. Census blocks are statistical areas bounded by visible features, such as streets, roads, streams, and railroad tracks, and by nonvisible boundaries, such as property lines, and city, township, school district, and county limits, and short line-of-sight extensions of streets and roads. Note: this dataset doesn't include the census blocks, for example, that consist of water polygons, medians, access ramps, and land enclosures.
enttyp.enttypds: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for the state or territory in which the block is located.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 38-2009, (Formerly FIPS 5-2) Codes for the Identification of the States and Equivalent Areas within the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdef: The code (two-digit number) for the state in which the block is located.

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 38-2009, (Formerly FIPS 5-2) Codes for the Identification of the States and Equivalent Areas within the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdef: The code (three-digit number) for the county in which the block is located.

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 31-2009, (Formerly FIPS 6-4) Codes for the Identification of Counties and Equivalent Areas of the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdef: The combined state and county codes. County codes begin with 001 for each state; use the combined code (five-digit number) to uniquely identify a county.

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 38-2009, (Formerly FIPS 5-2) Codes for the Identification of the States and Equivalent Areas within the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas; INCITS 31-2009, (Formerly FIPS 6-4) Codes for the Identification of Counties and Equivalent Areas of the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdef: The four-digit number, with a two-digit suffix, used to identify a census tract.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

attr.attrdef: The Census code (one-digit number) for the block group.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

attr.attrdef: The Census code (three-digit number) for the block.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

attr.attrdef: The combined state, county, tract, block group, and block Census codes. The combined code (15-digit number) provides a unique block identifier.

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 38-2009, (Formerly FIPS 5-2) Codes for the Identification of the States and Equivalent Areas within the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas; INCITS 31-2009, (Formerly FIPS 6-4) Codes for the Identification of Counties and Equivalent Areas of the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas; Federal Information Processing Standards
codesetd.codesets: American National Standards Institute; U.S. Department of Commerce

attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

attr.attrdef: The total number of households in the block in 2020.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

attr.attrdef: The total number of housing units in the block in 2020.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

digtinfo.formcont: To use this data requires software that works with FGDB files.
